article_title: Sunday letters: Houston's growth, brothels, rich schools
article_text: To continue reading this story, you will need to be a digital subscriber to HoustonChronicle.com.

article_metadata.description: Regarding "In takedown of brothels, local pilot charged as pimp" (Page A1, Friday), for operations like this to exist there has to be a customer base.  Regarding "Houston area's growth spurt continues despite oil bust" (Page A1, Thursday) and "Threatened or endangered animals in Texas" (Page A2), running these two pieces so close together should remind us that all this growth comes at a price.  Besides the extra burden it places on public services and infrastructure as housing developers gobble up more prairie and forest, animal species are pushed to extinction through loss of habitat.  President Obama tries to make us believe that the Constitution is what he holds most dear in his decision-making, although there are many of us that feel he has been very loose in his adherence to constitutional values.  Actions have consequences, and ramming the Affordable Care Act down our throats and the huge accumulation of debt by a political party out of control and bent on having its way have not been forgotten.  Regarding "Rice among rich schools questioned about rate hikes" (Page A1, Tuesday), rising tuition costs in colleges and universities - public and private - is indeed a concern, but federal lawmakers are barking up the wrong tree, as usual.
